name: Hilton Barbados Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've recently returned from a fantastic stay at the Hilton. We've been to a number of Hiltons around the world and have to say this is right up there with the best.
reviews.title: Fantastic wedding - now planning a return trip

reviews.text: We had arranged for a twiglight wedding at the Charles Fort and everything was fantastic - exceded expectations. Jo-Ann and Simone were brilliant in arranging everything for us. The Beauty salon were fantastic in preparing for the big event.
reviews.title: Would Never Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every member of staff in the hotel was cheerful and friendly, We used the beach bar and room service quite a lot and the pool and grounds were always spotless.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Island....

reviews.text: We are currently in the process of arranging a trip back again next January and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Two of our friends - on seeing the wedding photos are seriously thinking about following suit too.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone especially with young children. My husband took myself and tour wo children away for my 40th birthday, we were at the hotel for a very long week. Although they advertise a kids program there is nothing going on. They have two rooms with a TV, air-hockey table and some blocks. The girl who worked the room was very nice but informed me that since this is not a busy time where there are lots of kids at the hotel there is no daily itinerary. So...there are no activities at the pool, beach, anywhere....
reviews.title: I would never return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are in our 30'-40's and we travel twice a year. We have been to many Carribean Islands with land and cruise packages. Our first time in Barbados by cruise was great so we planned this trip about six years later. We were on a budget and did not plan on spending a fortune on food and transportation.
reviews.title: Not exactly what we expected.....

reviews.text: We took a taxi from the airport which cost about $25. The taxi driver must have taken us through the most unscenic roads with neighborhoods that looked poverty stricken. When we reached the Hilton it was more of the same. The Southern coastline seemed to have a lot of poverty. We found out quickly that there is one other hotel nearby and only one other restaurant. We felt like we were stranded with eating expensive food at hotel. Our first night the staff recommended St Lawrence Gap for dinner. We had to walk about 4 deserted blocks to main road in order to take buses. We were not impressed w/ St Lawrence Gap. It was an older town with 2 blocks of overpriced restaurants that were completely deserted. We ate at Ships Inn restaurant there and had tasteless fish for cost of about $75. We decided to go to nearby shopping centers that were on road to St Lawrence for our future dinners and once went to Oistens Fish Fry. We ate breakfast at hotel because it was priced better than other meals, had an occasional sandwich for lunch there which is about $18 each, and dinner one night which food was not worth the money.
reviews.title: Great stay with some minor negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 323 which had an excellent, gorgeous view of the beach. The room furniture and decor was okay. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. Both my husband and I had backaches after sleeping in bed during 7 day vacation. The shower tile needed to be cleaned better there was quite a bit of mildew growth. I would also recommend a loveseat in rooms w/ king sized beds so there is a place to sit.
reviews.title: Very good, great by Caribbean cstandards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was beautiful, but very small compared to other resorts we stayed at. There was 2 large swimming pools, a baby pool, hot tub and one beach restaurant. In hotel building there were 2 other restaurants w/ limited expensive menus. The beach had white powder sand and crystal clear water, but water was rough w/ lots of waves. There was practically no entertainment. The only entertainment we saw was a solo steel drum player at about 3pm in afternoon for a couple of hours a couple times a week. So I will recommend that you bring lots of reading material. There is absolutely nothing to do in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great for a Quick Getaway

reviews.text: We traveled quite a bit using bus system, but also needed to take taxis occasionally. I think that we would have enjoyed Barbados more if we rented a car. But because we would need to drive on right side of car on left side of road we decided against being that adventurous.
reviews.title: Over Priced WIth Terrible Service

reviews.text: Had an executive floor room with access to the 8th floor lounge. It was a King Bed room with a balcony facing the ocean. Good air conditioning and lots of hot water. An absolutely beautiful view over the beach. Room could have used a table or additional seating space - there was 1 easy chair and 1 desk with chair. Makes it a bit difficult for eating in the room. Balcony outside had two chairs and a table.
reviews.title: Comfortable Executive Floor Stay

reviews.text: Staying in the Executive Room is approximately $50 extra - which may be worth it. Since my wife was with me, the access to the lounge was great. There was always tea, coffee or soft drinks available up until 11pm. The lounge also has free WiFi. It also provides continental breakfast, high tea and appetizers.
reviews.title: Excutive Breakfast very disappointing

reviews.text: Recommend eating outside at the Lighthouse Terrace restaurant and the pool bar. Had a good drink and meal at indoor bar, but who really wants to eat indoors in the Barbados? There are a number of good restaurants within a short cab ride and one buffet restaurant in walking distance.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton Barbados over 20 times. The staff below management level are fantastic and bore the brunt of visitors complaints.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel, above the standard Hilton quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Excutive continental breakfast has not changed over 5 years and becomes exceptionally boring when you are there for 15 days. This was not really a problem until recently when you could request a coupon and have a continental breakfast at the lighthouse which had much more choice. On my last visit (November 2010) they told me on arrival that they have withdrawn the coupon and should l wish to have a continental breakfast downstairs i would now have to pay!!!!!!! You will also find that they only charge one price at the lighthouse breakfast buiffet, whereas before you could pay for either a continental or the full buffet (includes Sausages, Eggs etc) you now pay just one price,
reviews.title: Great job Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Barbados Hilton and it was fantastic!! The staff was very friendly, the weather was very nice, the rooms were excellent, and the restaurants were very good. The restaurants were not overly expensive for the Carribean and the food was very good. The people of Barbados were very friendly. We rented a jeep one day and drove around the entire island. We always felt safe. There is a restarant on the Atlantic side near Bathsheba that was beautiful. I believe it was called the Round House Inn and Restaurant. I think flights to Barbados can be expensive, but we used miles. The Executive Lounge was nice at the Hilton. The beach was beautiful and there is great diving and snorkeling in Barbados. I would highly recommend the Barbados Hilton.
reviews.title: Awesome!!

reviews.text: It was my first time in Barbados and my first stay at the Hilton. The large Group that I went with have stayed there the last 3 years.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay, Staff went out of their way for us.

reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: We arrived with about 20 folks from the airport. We were greated very quickly with a rum punch and the staff opened up more areas for us to check in faster since there was so many of us.
reviews.title: Nothing Fancy, but a Great Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach:
reviews.title: Exactly what I expected only better!

description: Winner of a 2012 TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence, the luxurious Hilton Barbados Resort enjoys a prime location on the lush tropical peninsula of Needham's Point in Barbados. Each of our 350 lavishly-appointed ocean front rooms & suites is imbued with the comfort and style you’ve come to you expect from Hilton. With amenities tailored for couples, families, and business travelers alike, the 100% non smoking and fully accessible Hilton Barbados Resort, really is a full service, versatile paradise for all. Just five minutes from the island’s capital, Bridgetown, 20 minutes from Grantley Adams International Airport and walking distance to the newly listed UNESCO World Heritage site of The Garrison, the 8-storey resort features a sprawling pool complex with whirlpool, as well as three premium tennis courts, four restaurants and a Fitness & Health Centre with spa treatment rooms overlooking Carlisle Bay.
